alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Upper Tularosa Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued March 16 at 6:43PM MDT until March 17 at 7:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...East winds 15 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Middle Rio Grande Valley including the Albuquerque Metro Area, and Upper Tularosa Valley. The strongest winds in the Albuquerque Metro Area will be below Tijeras Canyon, or along and south of the Interstate 40 corridor. * WHEN...Until 7 AM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs may be blown down. Expect strong crosswinds on north-to-south oriented roads like I-25 and U.S. Highway 54.
info.instruction: Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Use extra caution. Secure outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Upper Tularosa Valley
